intro: Lapathum bienne, commonly known as the two-yearly speedwell, is a biennial plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Scrophulariaceae and is characterized by its basal rosette of leaves and stems that grow upright in its second year. The plant produces small, blue or violet flowers that bloom in the summer months. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in meadows and along stream banks. Lapathum bienne is known for its medicinal properties and has been used traditionally in herbal remedies.
